m:properties.d:SpeakerDescription: Sanjay Soni is a Sr. Technical Product Marketing Manager in the SQL Server Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing Marketing team at Microsoft. Previous Microsoft roles include Business Intelligence Evangelist, responsible for enabling self-service BI to 40,000+ users at Microsoft. Sanjay is know for his passion, enthusiasm, driving structure, and delivering results for customers in the BI and Data Warehousing area during last 15 years of diversified experiences. He is an MCDBA, MCTS and specializes in Business Intelligence using MS technologies including Power BI, Analysis Services, Reporting Services, SharePoint BI, PDW etc. Sanjay has authored and presented a variety of papers and sessions in last 15 years at various BI conferences including Tech-Ed, BI Conference, PASS, SQL Connections, SharePoint Conference, and TDWI.

Stacia Varga is a Microsoft Data Platform MVP and SSAS Maestro with a Bachelor’s Degree in Social Sciences. A consultant, educator, author, and principal of Data Inspirations, her career spans more than 30 years, with a focus on improving business practices through technology.
Since 2000, Stacia has provided consulting and education services for Microsoft's Business Intelligence technologies. As Stacia Misner, she also authored several books covering the Microsoft BI stack.

Mark Tabladillo Ph.D. works for Microsoft as a Cloud Solution Architect for the US CTO Customer Success Team. He has a science doctorate from Georgia Tech. Based in Atlanta, GA, Mark provides cloud enterprise solutions for companies in the US for Microsoft's strategic clients. He is a chapter leader for the PASS Data Science virtual chapter.

Mark Tabladillo Ph.D. works for Microsoft as a Cloud Solution Architect for the US CTO Customer Success Team. He has a science doctorate from Georgia Tech. Based in Atlanta, GA, Mark provides cloud enterprise solutions for companies in the US for Microsoft's strategic clients. He is a chapter leader for the PASS Data Science virtual chapter.

Paul is a Principal Consultant for Pragmatic Works, a Mentor and Microsoft Data Platform MVP. He consults, writes, speaks, teaches & blogs about business intelligence and reporting solutions. He works with companies around the world to model data, visualize and deliver critical information to make informed business decisions; using the Microsoft data platform and business analytics tools. He is a Director of the Oregon Data Community PASS chapter & user group, the author and lead author of Professional SQL Server 2016 Reporting Services and 14 other titles from Wrox & Microsoft Press. He holds several certifications including MCSE for the Data Platform and BI.

Grant Paisley is a Data Platform MVP and founder of Angry Koala, a Microsoft Business Intelligence partner based in Sydney, Australia. Grant is president of the SQL Server Usergroup Sydney and created http://reportsurfer.com, a community built around reporting, where you can also run the reports. He was contributing author for "SQL Server 2008 Analysis Services with MDX" and "Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services Recipes".

Jen Stirrup, Microsoft Regional Director and MVP is a well-known Business Intelligence and Data Visualization expert, author, data strategist, and Master of Business Administration (MBA) student in London. Jen leads a boutique analytics consultancy, delivering strategic advice to companies large and small.
Jen has presented in Africa, India, Europe and North America. Jen has presented at Ignite, Techorama, TechEd, PASS Summit, SQLBits, and SQLSaturday events in Europe and the US. She also delivers the MAPA Azure Architects course worldwide with Microsoft team members. Jen was also featured on the Best of PASS Summit 2015 DVD as one of the top 10 speakers. Jen also was awarded PASS prestigious PASSion Award in 2012

Peter Myers is a consultant, trainer and presenter, and has worked with Microsoft database and development products since 1997. Today he specializes in all Microsoft Business Intelligence products and also authors training course content for Microsoft products and services.
He has a broad business background supported by a bachelor’s degree in applied economics and accounting, and he extends this with extensive experience backed by current MCSE certifications. He has been a Data Platform MVP since 2007.

Reza Rad is a Microsoft Regional Director, MVP, author, trainer, speaker and consultant. He is a Microsoft Data Platform MVP for nine years from 2011. Reza wrote many books on Power BI subjects including the Power BI from Rookie to Rock Star, and Pro Power BI Architecture. Reza is the invited speaker at the world's well-known conferences such as Microsoft Ignite, Microsoft Business Applications Summit, Ignite Tour, PASS Summit, and many other conferences. Reza is an active blogger and writes regularly about Power BI at https://radacad.com.

Miguel is a Program Manager at Microsoft, working on Power Query since Day 1 of the project. Miguel is in charge of creating data discovery, import and transformation experiences that delight Information Workers and other BI users, as well as driving Community and Customer engagements for Power Query.
While Miguel is directly responsible for most of the painful experiences in Power Query today, he is also committed to listening every customer's feedback to improve the product.

Miguel is a Program Manager at Microsoft, working on Power Query since Day 1 of the project. Miguel is in charge of creating data discovery, import and transformation experiences that delight Information Workers and other BI users, as well as driving Community and Customer engagements for Power Query.
While Miguel is directly responsible for most of the painful experiences in Power Query today, he is also committed to listening every customer's feedback to improve the product.

Riccardo Muti is a Group Program Manager for SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) at Microsoft. Since joining the Reporting Services team a little over a year ago, he's worked on overhauling and modernizing the product and integrating Datazen technology to deliver SSRS 2016. Today, he continues to work on delivering on Microsoft's on-premises BI roadmap, including an on-premises self-service BI solution built on Power BI Desktop reports.
Before joining the Reporting Services team, Riccardo worked on Power BI, guiding the design and delivery of core functionality such as the data visualization canvas and the ability to pin visualizations to dashboards for monitoring.
Riccardo is a regular speaker at PASS Summit and other conferences.

Sandy Rivas is a Program Manager for Power BI at Microsoft. A 17+ year Microsoft veteran, she has shipped numerous Microsoft products. She manages the Power BI online Community and Power BI User Groups across the world. Her real-world use of Power BI with her brother’s business has given her a keen insight to the practical uses and value of self-service BI. Sandy has a passion for empowering customers to master their data through self-service BI. Her practical experience & enthusiasm is contagious!

Sandy Rivas is a Program Manager for Power BI at Microsoft. A 17+ year Microsoft veteran, she has shipped numerous Microsoft products. She manages the Power BI online Community and Power BI User Groups across the world. Her real-world use of Power BI with her brother’s business has given her a keen insight to the practical uses and value of self-service BI. Sandy has a passion for empowering customers to master their data through self-service BI. Her practical experience & enthusiasm is contagious!

Sandy Rivas is a Program Manager for Power BI at Microsoft. A 17+ year Microsoft veteran, she has shipped numerous Microsoft products. She manages the Power BI online Community and Power BI User Groups across the world. Her real-world use of Power BI with her brother’s business has given her a keen insight to the practical uses and value of self-service BI. Sandy has a passion for empowering customers to master their data through self-service BI. Her practical experience & enthusiasm is contagious!

Hi, my name is Jason. I spend most of my day helping clients solve business problems mostly in the Data and Advanced Analytics spaces. Sometimes this involves various and sundry cloud technologies including Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Databricks, HDInsight and Azure SQL Database. I'm fluent in several languages including: SQL, C#, Python, and PowerShell.
I'm a Microsoft Certified Master of SQL Server (MCM) and have been recognized for my technical excellence and evangelism efforts by Microsoft by being awarded the Most Valuable Professional (MVP) for the last 5+ years.
In my off hours I like to snowboard, karaoke, ride roller coasters, and play arcade games

Theresa Palmer is a Program Manager in the Microsoft SQL Server Information Services Group. She is currently working on Microsoft Power Query for Excel, which offers end user experiences around data discovery, data consumption, and data mashups.

David Smith is the R Community Lead at Microsoft. With a background in data science, he writes daily about applications of predictive analytics at the Revolutions blog (blog.revolutionanalytics.com), and is a co-author of “Introduction to R”, the R manual. Follow David on Twitter as @revodavid.

Miguel is a Sr. Program Manager for Power BI at Microsoft in charge of real-time experiences. Chilean, amateur musician, soccer and (very recent) ice hockey player, entertainment and data frenetic fan. Previous experience in transport, tourism, retail and tech industries. Miguel holds Industrial and Electrical Engineering degrees, and an MBA from Berkeley-Haas 2011.

Miguel is a Sr. Program Manager for Power BI at Microsoft in charge of real-time experiences. Chilean, amateur musician, soccer and (very recent) ice hockey player, entertainment and data frenetic fan. Previous experience in transport, tourism, retail and tech industries. Miguel holds Industrial and Electrical Engineering degrees, and an MBA from Berkeley-Haas 2011.

Leila Etaati is the First Microsoft AI MVP in New Zealand and Australia, as well as a Data Platform MVP. She has a Ph.D. from the University of Auckland and is the co-director and data scientist in RADACAD company with many clients around the world. Additionally, she is the co-organizer of Microsoft Business Intelligence and Power BI Use group in Auckland with more than 1300 members. Leila has also co-organized 3 main conferences in Auckland: SQL Saturday Auckland (from 2015), Difinity (from 2017) and Global AI Bootcamp. She is a data scientist, BI consultant, trainer, and speaker. She is a well-known International speaker to many conferences such as MS Ignite, SQL PASS, Data Platform Summit, SQL Saturday, Power BI World Tour and in Europe, USA, Asia, Australia, and NZ. She has over 10 years’ experience with databases and software systems. Leila is an active Technical Microsoft AI blogger in RADACAD.

Jordan Goldmeier is an internationally recognized spreadsheet and data visualization expert, author, producer, and Excel MVP. He is the owner of Cambia Factor data consulting agency and the author of Advanced Excel Essentials. Jordan challenges companies to rethink how they use their data by focusing on returning value rather than acquiring and implementing new technology. He has consulted with and provided training for the North American Treaty Alliance, the United States Air Force and Navy, the Pentagon, the University of Cincinnati, Financial Times, and others.

Dan Fylstra is founder and President of Frontline Systems Inc., an analytics software developer and marketer active in the Microsoft ecosystem for 25 years. Frontline’s software for Excel complements the Power BI suite and supports the full range of advanced analytics.
Prior to founding Frontline Systems, Dan was a serial entrepreneur who co-founded several software companies and a biotech venture.

Dan Fylstra is founder and President of Frontline Systems Inc., an analytics software developer and marketer active in the Microsoft ecosystem for 25 years. Frontline’s software for Excel complements the Power BI suite and supports the full range of advanced analytics.
Prior to founding Frontline Systems, Dan was a serial entrepreneur who co-founded several software companies and a biotech venture.

Dean Abbott is Co-Founder and Chief Data Scientist of SmarterHQ. Mr. Abbott is an internationally recognized data mining and predictive analytics expert with three decades of experience applying advanced data mining algorithms, data preparation techniques, and data visualization methods to real-world problems, including customer analytics, fraud detection, risk modeling, text mining, survey analysis, planned giving, and many more.
Mr. Abbott is the author of Applied Predictive Analytics (Wiley, 2014) and co-author of IBM SPSS Modeler Cookbook (Packt Publishing, 2013). He is a highly-regarded and popular speaker at Predictive Analytics and Data Mining conferences worldwide, and is on the Advisory Boards for the UC/Irvine Predictive Analytics Certificate as well as the UCSD Data Mining Certificate programs.
He holds a B.S. in Mathematics of Computation from Rensselaer (1985) and a Master of Applied Mathematics from the University of Virginia (1987)

Dean Abbott is Co-Founder and Chief Data Scientist of SmarterHQ. Mr. Abbott is an internationally recognized data mining and predictive analytics expert with three decades of experience applying advanced data mining algorithms, data preparation techniques, and data visualization methods to real-world problems, including customer analytics, fraud detection, risk modeling, text mining, survey analysis, planned giving, and many more.
Mr. Abbott is the author of Applied Predictive Analytics (Wiley, 2014) and co-author of IBM SPSS Modeler Cookbook (Packt Publishing, 2013). He is a highly-regarded and popular speaker at Predictive Analytics and Data Mining conferences worldwide, and is on the Advisory Boards for the UC/Irvine Predictive Analytics Certificate as well as the UCSD Data Mining Certificate programs.
He holds a B.S. in Mathematics of Computation from Rensselaer (1985) and a Master of Applied Mathematics from the University of Virginia (1987)

Ken Puls, FCPA, FCMA is a Chartered Professional Accountant, author, and trainer. With over 20 years of experience as a corporate controller and business owner, he has been exposed to many business systems, databases, and analysis tools, leading to a career of building Excel and Power BI-driven applications to harness data and turn it into management information.
A Microsoft Excel/Data Platform MVP since 2006 and author of 2 books, Ken has also been recognized as a Fellow of CPA Canada.

Ken Puls, FCPA, FCMA is a Chartered Professional Accountant, author, and trainer. With over 20 years of experience as a corporate controller and business owner, he has been exposed to many business systems, databases, and analysis tools, leading to a career of building Excel and Power BI-driven applications to harness data and turn it into management information.
A Microsoft Excel/Data Platform MVP since 2006 and author of 2 books, Ken has also been recognized as a Fellow of CPA Canada.

Rick is the Cohost of Excel.TV and the Director of Business Intelligence Services at EPI-USE America Consulting. Rick combines a TDWI Certification in Business Intelligence Leadership & Management, a Six Sigma Blackbelt Certification, and 20 years of Executive/Director-Level leadership. He started his analytics and reporting career as credit risk modeler and financial analyst for Citibank in 1994. He gained extensive experience in process improvement and earned a Six Sigma Blackbelt in 2006.

Avichal (Avi) Singh is a Principal Consultant at PowerPivotPro, where he has helped others transform their BI world by blogging, training, and consulting. He is currently co-authoring the 2nd edition of "DAX Formulas for PowerPivot".
Avi has personally experienced the transformation and empowerment that Power BI can bring, going from an Excel user to building large-scale Power BI platforms for 600+ users within Microsoft. His mission now is to share his knowledge about Power BI.

Avichal (Avi) Singh is a Principal Consultant at PowerPivotPro, where he has helped others transform their BI world by blogging, training, and consulting. He is currently co-authoring the 2nd edition of "DAX Formulas for PowerPivot".
Avi has personally experienced the transformation and empowerment that Power BI can bring, going from an Excel user to building large-scale Power BI platforms for 600+ users within Microsoft. His mission now is to share his knowledge about Power BI.

Szilvia Juhasz is the founder of XSzil Consulting, co-host at Excel.TV, and a “Business / IT diplomat”. As a management consultant, Szilvia aims to disrupt traditional Excel-thinking by exposing her clients and their analysts toward better design practices, and Excel-BI systems integration methods. Her public and private Excel workshops are widely noted in her current home town of Los Angeles for their fun, entertaining style. Szilvia recently collaborated with Bill Jelen aka “Mr Excel” and co-authored MrExcel XL: The 40 Greatest Excel Tips of All Time in celebration of Excel’s 30th anniversary.

Matt is a BI Professional with over 30 years’ experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods industry. He has held senior job commercial and IT roles, always leveraging data to drive success. Matt was the BI Director for Asia Pacific at The Coca-Cola Company before leaving to set up his own consulting business in 2014.
Matt is now the Principal Consultant at Excelerator BI and specialises in helping small, medium and large companies leverage Microsoft Excel, Power Pivot, Power BI and SharePoint to deliver rapid business value through Self Service Business Intelligence.

Jeff is a Finance Director at Microsoft, which he joined in 2000. In his work with Enterprise Services, Jeff makes extensive use of Microsoft’s BI tools to analyze sales trends and educate business partners and stakeholders. He a regular presenter at the Executive Briefing Center and has made a number of trips to work directly with Microsoft customers in building out their own analytics. An avid traveler, Jeff has lived in Kazakhstan, Singapore and Germany.

Marco is a Business Intelligence consultant and mentor. He wrote several books about Power BI, Analysis Service, and Power Pivot. He also regularly writes articles and white papers that are available on sqlbi.com. Marco is a Microsoft MVP and an SSAS Maestro, the highest level of certification on Microsoft Analysis Services. Today, Marco focuses his time with SQLBI customers, traveling extensively to train and consult on DAX and data modeling for Power BI and Analysis Services. Marco also teaches public classes worldwide. Marco is a regular speaker at international conferences like Microsoft Ignite, PASS Summit, and SQLBits. He also enjoys delivering evening sessions at local user groups during his trips.

Ginger Grant manages the consultancy Desert Isle Group and shares what she has learned while working with data technology to people around the world. As a Microsoft MVP in Data Platform, Microsoft Certified Trainer and an instructor on DataCamp, she focuses on guiding clients to create solutions using the entire Microsoft Data Stack, which includes SQL Server, Power BI, and Azure Data Cloud components. When not working, she protypes the latest pre-release data technologies, maintains her blog http://www.desertislesql.com, and spends time on twitter @desertislesql.

Andrew J. Brust is the Senior Director, Market Strategy and Intelligence at Datameer and writes a blog for ZDNet called "Big on Data" (bit.ly/bigondata). Andrew is co-author of "Programming Microsoft SQL Server 2012" (Microsoft Press); an advisor to the NY Technology Council; serves as Microsoft Regional Director and MVP; is conference co-chair of Visual Studio Live!; and writes Visual Studio Magazine's "Redmond Review" column.

I am an entrepreneur and a data analyst with over 15 years of experience working with international corporations on simple and complex data problems. I am attracted to data since I was a kid. After 5 years in the hedge funds industry, Working on analysis of complex IR derivatives, I founded Excelando.
Excelando looks at data analysis and BI from a different angel. By using agile BI tools and a bottom-up approach we manage to give value for our customers in a fraction of the cost and time.
Excelando is a team of skilled and experienced analysts who were trained to become "SUPER" analysts - which means they not only define the critical KPIs, But also search for the data, load it , prepare it , analyze it and display. they DELIVER.

Jen Underwood, a Senior Director at DataRobot, has held worldwide analytics product management roles at Microsoft and served as a technical lead for system implementation firms. She has over 20 years of experience launching new products and turning around failed projects in enterprise data warehousing, reporting, and advanced analytics. Today she designs product and helps analytics professionals learn how to solve complex problems with machine learning in the emerging citizen data science segment.
Jen has a Bachelor of Business Administration – Marketing, Cum Laude from the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee and a post-graduate certificate in Computer Science – Data Mining from the University of California, San Diego.

Jen Underwood, a Senior Director at DataRobot, has held worldwide analytics product management roles at Microsoft and served as a technical lead for system implementation firms. She has over 20 years of experience launching new products and turning around failed projects in enterprise data warehousing, reporting, and advanced analytics. Today she designs product and helps analytics professionals learn how to solve complex problems with machine learning in the emerging citizen data science segment.
Jen has a Bachelor of Business Administration – Marketing, Cum Laude from the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee and a post-graduate certificate in Computer Science – Data Mining from the University of California, San Diego.

Michelle Ufford is a published author, popular presenter, award-winning blogger, Microsoft Data Platform MVP, and well-known thought leader in the data industry. She has worked with virtually every aspect of the data lifecycle over the past 16 years and spent the prior 8 years building analytics infrastructure at GoDaddy. She's presently geeking out at Netflix on the Data Engineering & Analytics (DEA) team. She blogs at hadoopsie.com and can be found on Twitter @sqlfool.

Douglas is a Senior Solution Specialist for WhereScape, and has worked in data warehousing primarily on SQL Server for 12 years. In that time he has worked as a BI Specialist, moved on to work as a BI consultant for Microsoft and finally to WhereScape as a solution specialist. Doug has managed projects for airlines, banks, casinos, retailers and utility companies using all aspects of SQL Server.

Bill has a passion for bridging the gap between data curiosity and data fluency. His interests and experiences range from writing SQL queries that wrangle and transform data to creating functional and aesthetically pleasing visualizations. Data analytics is the medium by which he provides others with greater meaning in their work.

Danielle Stein Fairhurst (MBA) is the Principal of Plum Solutions, a Sydney-based consultancy specialising in financial modelling and analysis. She is the author of “Using Excel for Business Analysis: A Fundamental Approach to Financial Modelling”. With over 14 years of experience as a financial analyst, she has regular speaking engagements in Australia and globally, and helps her clients create meaningful financial models and reports.

Danielle Stein Fairhurst (MBA) is the Principal of Plum Solutions, a Sydney-based consultancy specialising in financial modelling and analysis. She is the author of “Using Excel for Business Analysis: A Fundamental Approach to Financial Modelling”. With over 14 years of experience as a financial analyst, she has regular speaking engagements in Australia and globally, and helps her clients create meaningful financial models and reports.

Alex Hambelton is the Associate Research and Analytics Manager for the Oregon Lottery, a billion-dollar organization. Alex first joined the Oregon Lottery in 2001 and has been instrumental in the implementation of many of the company’s current analytical and data visualization practices. He is responsible for leading the organization’s Video Lottery analytics and business intelligence initiative. He holds a B.S. in Business Administration from Eastern Oregon University.

Kevin is a statistician with 20+ years experience applying the statistical sciences to solve problems in engineering, scientific, and business enviornments. He has taught in both academic and corporate enviornments, having served on the faculty of three universities and on the editorial boards for the International Journal of Data Sciences and the Applied Marketing Analytics Journal. Kevin is Director of Consulting Services for Minitab, Inc.

Stephen Giles is Director of Data Maturity at Dimensional Strategies Inc. His passion is helping companies to see the big picture when it comes to their data platforms and to focus on value rather than technology and buzz words. That being said, he has worked on every SQL Server version since SQL Server 6.5. He lives with his wife and two children in sunny Markham, ON.

After 5 years of business intelligence and analytics for Buncombe County, Michael was asked to lead a new team based around business intelligence and process improvement for the county as a whole. He has served in that role for 18 months, making strides in multiple areas to both streamline aged and previously manual processes and provide important data in a more user-friendly fashion.

Adam is a Senior Director at Tallan, a national business technology consulting firm and Microsoft partner. In his role, he leads the delivery of complex enterprise information management solutions for clients in the New York metro area. Adam is also a Virtual Technical Specialist for Microsoft, speaking and presenting frequently at both Tallan's and Microsoft's events.

Peter Sprague is Vice President of Services and Sales engineering. He is responsible for overseeing customer enablement and sales engineering globally.
Peter brings more than 15 years of deep technical experience in business intelligence development, architecture and deployment. He has delivered dozens of successful BI solutions for major enterprises, including well-known names in the finance, telecommunications, packaged goods and healthcare fields.

Cole Nussbaumer Knaflic tells stories with data. She is the author of “Storytelling With Data: A Data Visualization Guide for Business Professionals” and writes the popular blog storytellingwithdata.com. She’s worked with some of the most data-driven companies on the planet, including Google, Adobe, JPMC, Target, and the World Bank. Her well-regarded workshops and presentations are highly sought after by numerous global companies and philanthropic organizations.

Mico Yuk is a BI veteran, teaching thousands globally how to harness the power of data visualization to create real business results. Mico speaks and blogs about everything business intelligence related and is the author of Data Visualization for Dummies (Wiley, 2014).
Mico is the founder of BI Brainz, a leader in enterprise visual solutions, and the BI Dashboard Formula (BIDF) coaching series, focusing on helping enterprises embrace a more visual culture. Her company has worked with leading organizations such as Kimberly-Clark, Shell, Nestle, Qatargas, Ericsson, and FedEx.

Mico Yuk is a BI veteran, teaching thousands globally how to harness the power of data visualization to create real business results. Mico speaks and blogs about everything business intelligence related and is the author of Data Visualization for Dummies (Wiley, 2014).
Mico is the founder of BI Brainz, a leader in enterprise visual solutions, and the BI Dashboard Formula (BIDF) coaching series, focusing on helping enterprises embrace a more visual culture. Her company has worked with leading organizations such as Kimberly-Clark, Shell, Nestle, Qatargas, Ericsson, and FedEx.

Paul Westerman is currently a Senior Marketing Research Analyst at the Oregon Lottery.
Prior to the Lottery he worked in the not-for-profit sector, including a software company in Boston, a consulting firm in New York and a cultural center in Los Angeles. Along the way he found himself immersed in multiple database conversions, but still had time to dabble in business intelligence by creating suites of financial/marketing reports, building forecasting models and programming a simple Executive Information System.
At the Lottery since 2013, he is now spending more of his time on strictly analytical and business intelligence oriented projects.
Christian Berg is a Senior Program Manager.
Dima Zaidalkilani is a Program Manager focused on Power BI in the Microsoft Data Group.
Johnnie Thomas is a Program Manager for Microsoft Office.
Johnnie Thomas is a Program Manager for Microsoft Office.
Scott Ruble is a Principal Program Manager for Microsoft Office.
Ted Way is a Program Manager focused on Big Data solutions in the Microsoft Data Group.
Ted Way is a Program Manager focused on Big Data solutions in the Microsoft Data Group.

Kevin has 20 years of experience in technology, with a focus on Big Data and the Cloud. He has held leadership roles with EMC and Symantec. Prior to receiving his MBA from Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley, Kevin was a financial writer with TheStreet.com, analyzing the data networking and telecommunications industries. Kevin has a bachelor of arts degree from Bowdoin College. He is an outdoor fitness nut, bookworm, husband and father of three boys. You can follow Kevin on Twitter at @KevinPetrieTech.

Uri Maoz is the Vice President of US business for Anodot based in San Francisco, California. Uri has over 15 years of experience in the software industry, in which he led Product Management, R&D and Business Development. He was in-charge for the development and implementation of various analytics and machine learning products. Uri is passionate about driving innovation from seed to product launch while creating an exceptional user experience and products that customers love. that customers love.

Dr. Sima Maleki works as consulting lead and analytics modeling specialist for Frontline Systems, developer of a variety of predictive and prescriptive analytics software tools, including Solver in Excel for optimization, Risk Solver for simulation/risk analysis, and XLMiner for data mining. As part of her work, Sima helps companies around the world effectively use analytics to leverage business opportunities and make better decisions. She has developed three self-service online training courses in predictive and prescriptive analytics (www.solver.com/training), and also regularly teaches live educational webinars on data mining, optimization, and simulation and risk analysis (www.solver.com/webinars).

James has worked with the Microsoft Stack for his entire career, beginning with sysadmin duties back in the days of NT through to programming with C and C++, working on databases from SQL 2000 and then through to BI for the last 9 years. Currently a Solutions Expert with Panorama, having held various positions within the company, consider well versed.
Over 15 years of Software Development experience – focused on big data challenges and solutions. Currently working at Hortonworks the leading purveyor of Spark and Hadoop Data Platforms.
